text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Biologist Nick Bos tells Wikinews about 'self-medicating' ants
text.summary1: (human1) Wikinews interviews biologist Nick Bos from the University of Helsinki about his experiments with ants, which show that ants 'self-medicate' by selecting food contaminated with toxic hydrogen peroxide when they are infected with fungus that can be treated using the chemical.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) University of Helsinki biologist Nick Bos and colleagues discovered that Formica fusca ants infected with fungus self-medicate by choosing hydrogen peroxide-laced food, marking the first documented case of insect self-medication.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) Wikinews interviews biologist Nick Bos about his research on Formica fusca ants' self-medicating behavior, revealing that infected ants choose food with toxic hydrogen peroxide to reduce mortality, an adaptation potentially applicable to other social insects, and highlighting his methods and the challenges of conducting low-budget scientific research.
text.summary4: (Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) Nick Bos, a biologist at the University of Helsinki, has discovered that ants infected with a fungus can self-medicate by consuming food laced with hydrogen peroxide, reducing their mortality rate by 15%.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Biologist Nick Bos describes a study showing that Formica fusca ants appear to engage in self-medicating behavior by choosing food laced with hydrogen peroxide to reduce mortality rates when infected with Beauveria bassiana fungus.
